message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper is about topic modeling, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. The paper specifically focuses on short texts, which are common in social media and other online platforms. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and related topics. The paper also mentions the use of probabilistic models, which suggests that it could belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) or cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper uses word embeddings, which are a popular technique in deep learning and artificial intelligence, indicating that it could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
